{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3326666,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T12:13:59.853Z","cooked":"

Our team is using Pathplanner to just run single paths “here and there” within our auto routine. When prior auto activity updates our odometry from camera measurement, our starting location is sometimes a little different from the starting location specified in the path. This results in the robot going the “wrong” direction for a little bit and then taking off on the desired path. I’m assuming that first little move is for it to try and get onto the exact trajectory in the path. We don’t really care about it being spot on at the start of the path though … just care about the middle and end of the path. Is there a simple way to tell Pathplanner to not care as much about the starting location being a little off of what is specified? Right now we have enableInitialReplanning in the Config set to “true”. Will our issue be solved by setting this to “false”? Ran out of time to test. Setting up for our first competition tonight! Overall it’s working well and didn’t want to experiment with that setting until more educated from people on here…

Just a guess here but could you make the desired path a very short path that is where your current path ends? This would not work if you need the path to route you around an obstacle, though.

Perhaps my question may be more specifically about the enableInitialReplanning setting in the config. We’ve read the API documentation, but don’t quite understand the real-life expected operation when toggling this setting. Anyone have a good explanation of what we should expect by changing this from true to false? Like I said, simply ran out of time to test things!

I haven’t fully tested it out, but the replanning config allows you to just pass False (don’t replan), or set error margins before the replan.

I’m also not certain that re-planning is what’s going on here…would have to look at the code. What you’re seeing is the robot doing the pathfindtopath, and then start the path.

So I think more what would be interesting to know, is for a given path (or auto) could you disable pathfinding to a path.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-07T13:44:07.487Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":17.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457701,"topic_slug":"pathplaner-start-of-path-question","display_username":"NewtonCrosby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31346,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplaner-start-of-path-question/457701/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3326719,"name":"mjbergman92","username":"mjbergman92","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjbergman92/{size}/219086_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-07T14:02:49.051Z","cooked":"

In my own words, after looking at the FollowPathCommand class initialize method:

image930×260 16.2 KB

If not a Choreo generated path AND you enabled initial replanning AND either the first point in the path is more than a quarter meter away OR …notOnheading

onHeading is calculated just above:

image875×254 20.7 KB

onHeading is true if either current speed is less than 0.25 meters per second OR the direction the robot is currently headed in is more than 30 degrees different from the heading at the start of the path.

Just to be clear, heading is the direction the robot is moving, while holonomic rotation is the direction the robot is facing.

Side note, there definitely is a bug here in this calculation for onHeading to be aware of. When your robot velocity is near zero, the vector direction can jump around in random directions, so replanning may think that your heading is off by more than 30 degrees simply because of jittering vector direction, causing unnecessary replanning.

This is from 2024.2.4 for clarity of PathplannerLib for Java. They may have fixed this in the updates, but I cannot guarantee it.
